Course.Title: ACADEMIC WRITTEN DISCOURSE II
Course.Description: Develop rhetorical strategies in English as well as skills for more effective reading, writing, critical thinking, and vocabulary development, as applied to the student's chosen major. Reading and writing emphasis. Pass/Fail. Placement by advisement only. Limited to students who are not native speakers of English.

Course.Title: SCULPTURE WKSH MODEL-CASTING
Course.Description: A studio course in the materials and methods of sculpture emphasizing individual expression and selection, though modeling and casting processes. Field Trip(s) Student required to purchase materials/supplies. Formerly:  FA 3277.

Course.Title: MGT OF CORPORATE FINANCE I
Course.Description: Management of Corporate Finance I is an entry-level undergraduate finance course. The course offers introduction to basics modern financial theory and practice of corporate finance. In particular, the course explores topics such as objectives of financial management, financial statement analysis, time value of money, risk and return, valuation of bonds and stocks, and fundamentals of capital budgeting.

Sections.CourseDescription: Management of Corporate Finance I is an entry-level undergraduate finance course. The course offers introduction to basics modern financial theory and practice of corporate finance. In particular, the course explores topics such as objectives of financial management, financial statement analysis, time value of money, risk and return, valuation of bonds and stocks, and fundamentals of capital budgeting.
MeetingsDisplay: Monday, Wednesday 7:00 PM - 8:15 PM COLL BUSINESS&PUBLIC MGT C423 (Lecture)
Sections.Comments: WENZHOU KEAN STUDENTS ONLY. sophomore ACCT only no overload due to capacity
Sections.FullTitleDisplay: FIN*3310*W01 MGT OF CORPORATE FINANCE I
Sections.Title: MGT OF CORPORATE FINANCE I
